title: Carolina Birth and Wellness- Acupuncture — Doulas, Placenta Encapsulation, Prenatal Massage
description: Integrative Acupuncture în Durham specializing in the treatment of reproductive health, mental wellness, and digestive disorders.
cleaned_text: Acupuncture Chinese Medicine, Restorative Yoga and Meditation to shift patients into physical and emotional ease Deep listening and unhurried, heart-centered care for each and every acupuncture session so you can feel empowered and educated to have agency in your own healing. Key Issues Addressed: OB/GYN: irregular menses, painful menses, PMS/PMDD, infertility, menopause symptoms, preconception education, postpartum care, lactation support Emotional / Psychological: anxiety, depression, OCD, seasonal affective disorder, stress, burnout, insomnia Gastrointestinal: bloating, acid reflux, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, IBS, IBD, hemorrhoids Pain / Orthopedic: neck pain, low back pain, knee pain, arthritis, TMJ, muscle spasms, neuropathy, post surgery healing, scar therapy, tension headaches Immune Functioning: seasonal allergies, autoimmune conditions, asthma Neurological: Parkinson's Disease (PD), stroke rehabilitation, Multiple Sclerosis (MS), Fibromyalgia, migraines Dermatology: rashes including eczema and psoriasis, acne Addiction recovery Treatments with Christa may include: Acupuncture: involves the insertion of sterile, single-use, fine needles strategically placed at specific areas of the body to promote healing Gua Sha: the stimulation of skin and muscles to encourage proper flow of energy, blood and body fluids and to alleviate pain Cupping: used for muscle pains and respiratory conditions Tui Na: Chinese medical massage Dietary and Lifestyle Guidance: offered on an individual basis in consideration of Western and Eastern Medicine research and philosophy Meditation Guidance: provided before or during treatments Meet Your Acupuncturist, Christa Christa holds a Masters of Science in Traditional Chinese Medicine. She graduated valedictorian from Pacific College of Health and Sciences in New York City where she completed over 3,300 hours of clinical and didactical hours. Currently, she is in the process of completing her Doctorate in Acupuncture with Chinese Herbal Medicine Specialization. She is a Diplomate of Oriental Medicine with the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (NCCAOM). In addition, she has over 8 years of yoga teaching experience and 16 years of meditation study and practice. More information on Christa and Riverwell Acupuncture
